quest.name: Ruby Doomsday
journal: The Resistance and Alliance forces prepare in earnest as a new threat looms on the horizon.

Upon receiving word of a fresh menace approaching the Eorzean front, you make your way to Ala Mhigo, where you are given the briefest of briefings. You are asked to meet with the Resistance troops at Porta Praetoria, where you will receive further instructions.

A member of the Resistance forces escorts you to Alliance Headquarters, where the tension in the air is palpable. While each and every soldier stationed there has a similar bleak expression etched on their face, one man in particular is even grimmer than the rest: Gaius Baelsar.

Gaius provides a detailed explanation of the encroaching Ruby Weapon and his failed attempt to destroy it. He and his loyal follower, Severa, tried to preemptively attack the gigantic machina using explosives, only for it to escape largely unscathed before turning to retaliate. Gaius was wounded protecting Severa, resigning the veteran combatant to the role of spectator until he has recovered. He reluctantly petitions your aid in eliminating the Ruby Weapon before it can reach Eorzea, warning you that its near-impenetrable armor plating and whip-like claws are most likely abilities stolen from absorbed primals. Once your preparations are complete, you are to speak with the Resistance soldier assigned as your escort to the battlefield.

The Resistance soldier is to take you to the expected point of contact with the Ruby Weapon before withdrawing to a safe distance. It is clear that this is a foe far beyond the capabilities of rank-and-file troops, and even you, conqueror of the original Ultima Weapon, may be pushed to your limits.

※Cinder Drift can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

The climactic battle finally draws to a close, and the Ruby Weapon falls silent. Though there are many mysteries surrounding the warmachina's connection with Nael van Darnus, the former legatus of the VIIth Legion whose apparition appeared during the encounter, it seems the answers must wait for the time being. Leaving the wreckage of the gargantuan machine behind, you head towards Alliance Headquarters.

As you turn to leave the battlefield, you are joined by Gaius, who has been observing the encounter from afar. Your conversation is interrupted by the arrival of imperial troops sent to salvage the wreckage of the Ruby Weapon. Strangely, it appears that not only are they acquaintances of Gaius's, but they address him as “Father,” even going so far as to ask him to return to Garlemald. Unwavering, he states that his days serving the Empire are over, though he soon loses his composure upon discovering that the pilot of the Ruby Weapon was a soldier named Milisandia. He angrily accuses the young imperials of failing to protect their sibling, to which the leader among them replies by stating that they only wished to finish what Gaius had started. They then withdraw, leaving you and the man once known as the Black Wolf to consider your next move.

Shortly after returning to Alliance Headquarters, Gaius is, for better or worse, reunited with his former ward, Cid Garlond, who has been sent to investigate the remains of the Ruby Weapon. Although the two Garleans share a troubled history, they decide to attend to the matters at hand rather than dwell on the past. Their exchange of words is remarkably brief, and you are soon left alone with Cid, who explains that he was one of several children that Gaius had taken into his care, which apparently also included Milisandia, pilot of the Ruby Weapon, though it seems that Cid was unfamiliar with her name until now. He then returns to the task of gathering information on your fallen foe and leaves for the battlefield.

Cid returns somewhat sooner than expected from his investigation with urgent news for Gaius. It seems that not only did Milisandia perish inside the Ruby Weapon's cockpit, as was feared, but her physical form was fused with its core, a horrific spectacle that has left Cid visibly shaken. The Empire, not content to stop at using its pilots as disposable commodities, appears to be dabbling in implanting combat data from elite soldiers such as the deceased Nael van Darnus into living hosts, though the exact methods are as yet unclear. While the immediate threat of the Ruby Weapon has been eliminated, the possibility of ever more dangerous foes cannot be ignored, so Cid, Gaius, and the other members of the group set about learning what they can of the Weapon project. You, on the other hand, are advised to rest in preparation for the struggles that lie ahead, though it would seem prudent to first inform the Resistance troops in Ala Mhigo of the outcome of the battle.

You return to Porta Praetoria to share the events surrounding your encounter with the Ruby Weapon. The details are quickly compiled into a written report to be conveyed to the higher ranks of the Resistance and Alliance, while a copy will be retained at the camp for you to peruse at your leisure, should you feel so inclined. The information you have provided may prove to be invaluable in the days to come, as it is clear the danger posed by the Weapon project is far from over.
objectives: Confront the Ruby Weapon in Cinder Drift.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Glad you could make it.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: As you may have heard, Commander Aldynn has given orders to embark from Alliance Headquarters to hold back the advance of the Empire's latest menace.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Not that the soldiers stationed there are too chuffed about being on the front line against these new Weapons. If they're designed to slay primals, they'd make short work of us mere mortals as well.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Mind you, it's Gaius Baelsar and his followers who've led the charge so far. By all accounts, they've been giving as good as they get.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, their sorties have met with little success. I daresay they'd benefit greatly from your presence on the battlefield. If you're ready, my colleague over at Porta Praetoria will show you the way.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: On your way to headquarters, I take it?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Accompany the Resistance fighter to Alliance Headquarters?

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: He was told to wait for you at the foot of the long set of stairs. I imagine he's milling about at the camp, trying not to step in any chocobo shite.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: So, your mind is set?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Then I shall apprise you of the situation.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: We have discovered that the previously abandoned Ultima Weapon project is being helmed by the reformed VIIth Legion.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: They have already succeeded in producing several prototypes, one of which is set to be deployed on the Eorzean front. Its name: the Ruby Weapon.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa and I were able to get within striking distance during one of its test runs and made an attempt to destroy it.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: An attempt that ended in failure, alas. Based on our knowledge of the original Ultima Weapon, the explosives we employed should have been sufficient to blast through its armor plating, but they barely left a mark.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: We suspect the gifts of its predecessor may have proven the source of its resilience.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: As you well know, the Ultima Weapon was designed to absorb aether from eikons, and the Ruby Weapon no doubt shares that ability. If any were summoned during the uprisings in Garlemald's occupied territories, and thereafter consumed, our enemy would become all the more formidable.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: But its near-impenetrable armor was only the beginning of our troubles.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It fought back with whip-like claws that can be extended and contracted at will. In the face of such opposition, we were forced to withdraw.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Gaius was injured shielding me from the Ruby Weapon's assault. Even now, he struggles to stand. Damn it all! If I hadn't been so careless, this wouldn't have happened.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You need not concern yourself. Let us not forget that I am the one who initiated the Ultima Weapon project. If I must give my life to bury this shameful legacy, then so be it.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: If you were to face it as you are now, you'd be cut down before you even hobbled within firing distance.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: In any case, we can't afford to lose the information in your head, on both the foe we face and the Empire itself. We all know that asking for Forename's assistance presents our best chance of stopping that warmachina.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that if anyone were capable of putting down such a monstrosity, it would be herhim.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Though I have no right to ask this of you, will you lend us your strength?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm not one to back down from a fight.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I do this for Eorzea.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You have my thanks.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: And mine, though I must impress upon you the urgency of our situation. We have received word that the Empire is preparing to advance on the Ghimlyt Dark. That is where we will intercept them.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: If our fears are proven correct, the Ruby Weapon will be among their host. Should it break through our lines, there is no telling the devastation it will wreak. Make no mistake, the very survival of Eorzea hangs in the balance.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Once you have steeled yourself for the battle ahead, your escort will lead the way.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: ...What price must the world pay for my hubris?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A short while earlier, in the Garlean-occupied city of Werlyt's magitek installation...

dialogue.name: OPERATOR03783
dialogue.text: Commencing Ruby Weapon activation sequence. All units, stand by.

dialogue.name: OPERATOR03783
dialogue.text: Initiating synthetic auracite system... Fusion successful, no signs of incompatibility. Awaiting your signal.

dialogue.name: MILISANDIA
dialogue.text: (-Gutsy Female Voice-)Ruby Weapon, code name “Darnus.” Ready for launch!

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: To be honest, we weren't sure if you'd ever show up. I, for one, am glad you've decided to throw in your lot with us.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Gaius says you are our best hope of defeating that abomination. We have seen only a glimpse of its true power, and even that was more than enough for us.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: On your way to headquarters, I take it?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Accompany the Resistance fighter to Alliance Headquarters?

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: Valdeaulin has briefed me on our mission.

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: I am to take you as far as our expected point of contact with the Ruby Weapon. Once we arrive, the rest is up to you, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Not only are the Ruby Weapon's claws as quick as lightning, they move with an uncanny degree of flexibility, and can strike from where you least expect it.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Given all we've come to expect from the Ascians, it wouldn't surprise me if they were behind the summoning of whatever primals the Ruby Weapon has absorbed.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: Though I will not be able to join the battle with the Ruby Weapon, I have been tasked with keeping an escape route back to the Eorzean front clear, should you need to make a hasty retreat.

dialogue.name: CONVEYOR03783
dialogue.text: I am to take you as far as our expected point of contact with the Ruby Weapon. Once we arrive, the rest is up to you.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Even from afar your figure was unmistakable. As ever, an impressive display.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Though as I am sure you will concur, the Ultima Weapon pales in comparison to this new monstrosity. If their research is allowed to continue, the next model will be nigh on unstoppable.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: With that in mind, the Alliance has enlisted the help of─ Wait. I hear something.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Here to sift through what remains of the Ruby Weapon, are you?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: (-Imperial Soldier-)Allie! What do you think you're doing!?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Allie?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: (-Imperial Soldier-)Father!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It has been too long, Alfonse. And you too, Rex.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Given that the Empire is proceeding with the Weapon project and making inroads into Eorzea, I suppose it was only a matter of time until our paths crossed.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: It's wonderful to see you again, Father, although I can't say I think much of the company you've been keeping.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: I know a lot's happened, but I'm just glad you're all right. And now...you can come back to Garlemald with us!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: My days serving the Empire are over.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Because you're suspected of assassinating Emperor Varis?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: But we know you'd never do a thing like that! There must be a way to prove your innocence!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Then everything can go back to the way it was...

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: So he found you two shivering on the roadside when he was going through Werlyt. Lucky for you, eh?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: If he hadn't, we'd probably be dead by now.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: As for us three, our parents all died in the epidemic. We'd still be begging on street corners if it weren't for him.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: I just wish there was a way we could repay Lord Gaius for all the kindness he's shown us.

dialogue.name: MILISANDIA
dialogue.text: He fights for the Empire, so we should, too! That'll make him proud of us.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: You're saying we should join the army?

dialogue.name: RICON
dialogue.text: I don't think that's such a good idea... Everyone in Werlyt was scared of the Garleans. Why would we want to be like them?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Lord Gaius is different. I know he is.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: You're right. He always says that the strong should lead the weak. Maybe that's why he took us in.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: All right. If becoming a soldier is what it takes, I'll do it. Who's with me?

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Count me in! And maybe one day, people'll look up to us like we do Lord Gaius.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Then it's settled. From now on, we're all brothers and sisters fighting for the same cause.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Brothers and sisters? Then that would make Lord Gaius our...father?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Well, if he doesn't mind us calling him that, I suppose so.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: And that makes you our big brother, since you're the oldest! You'd better be nice to us, or I'm telling Father. Ha ha!

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Father... Since you went away, a lot has changed in the Empire. For us, too.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: If we'd known that you were still out there, still alive, none of this would've happened!

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: The truth is...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If you must go, I will not stop you, but answer me this: who was piloting the Ruby Weapon? We all know that Nael van Darnus has not returned from the dead.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Who do you think!?

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: It was...Milisandia.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: No... No, I refuse to believe that.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: I refuse to believe you would let that happen. She was a sister to you! To all of you!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: We only want to finish what you started.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: And while we will never forget all you have done for us, the next time we meet, it shall be as enemies. Good-bye, Father.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: As for you, hero of Eorzea, you'll pay for what you did to Milisandia. I swear it.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, well. Gaius van Baelsar. We meet again.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Come to see how your precious Weapon project has been proceeding in your absence, have you?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: You are come to collect data on the Ruby Weapon, correct? The pilot...Milisandia should still be inside the cockpit. I will ask Valdeaulin to escort you to the wreckage.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Any idea who this Milisandia is? An imperial crony of his, perhaps?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: One of the orphans...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Gaius always did have an eye for talent and a mind to nurture it. In fact, Livia sas Junius was another protégé of his.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: He even took me under his wing when my father became obsessed with the Meteor project. It's strange that I felt closer to Gaius than my own flesh and blood.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Then, my father and countless others lost their lives in the Bozja incident. Although he was acting under Emperor Solus's orders, he masterminded the whole thing.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'd begged him to reconsider, to put an end to this madness, but my words fell on deaf ears. That's when I turned to Gaius for support, but he was as much a pawn of the Emperor as my father, and refused to intervene. And when my turn came to serve, I defected and fled to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I blamed Gaius as much as any of them, perhaps even more, for the barbaric acts carried out in the name of conquest. But when we met at the Praetorium, all the hatred that had been festering inside me seemed to fade away, and I remembered the man I once respected.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: To think the dreaded Black Wolf was a mere plaything of the Ascians, who left him broken and disgraced, having sent thousands of his men to early graves. It's more than most could bear. And now the lives of the children he raised hang in the balance.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Any personal grievances I have with Gaius can wait. I'd best gather what information I can on the Ruby Weapon, but I'll be back as soon as possible.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Gaius wasn't exaggerating when he spoke of your prowess in battle. Unfortunately, it seems a fair few problems remain, and unlike the Ruby Weapon, it might take more than brute force to solve them.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: After Gaius and I faced the Ruby Weapon, I had thought it to be all but indestructible. I'm glad to be proven wrong on this occasion.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If Cid is as I remember him, it will not take long for him to finish investigating the remains of the Ruby Weapon. He never was one to waste time.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: My engineers are still in the field, but there's something I thought you should know right away.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's about the pilot. I'm not sure how to tell you this, but...

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: If Milisandia is dead, I only hope she was not made to suffer.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Death would have been a kindness... In all my years, I've never seen such a perversion of science and nature.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Her body was fused with the Ruby Weapon's core! Those last moments must have been spent in pure agony as her very life's essence was drained from her.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: So, she was sacrificed to power that infernal machine.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: We must act quickly if we are to prevent the Empire from committing further atrocities. Forename, is there any other information you can share with us regarding the Ruby Weapon prior to its...deactivation?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Nael van Darnus? Did the legatus mean that much to Milisandia?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: From what I gather, it sounds as if data based on Nael's combat capabilities was used to override the pilot's consciousness after she was fused with the core.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If this technology is perfected and the Empire begins implanting the memories of renowned warriors such as the White Raven into its soldiers, the Alliance won't stand a chance.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Is such a thing even possible?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: That's more or less how soul crystals work.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: A similar method of transference was used on the prototype Estinien fought, was it not?

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Yes, it seems that such crystals are in common use throughout Eorzea. An ancient but effective means of passing on knowledge from one generation to the next.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Your friend did mention he overheard the signiferi loading various sets of data into the test model during the battle. It would appear that the system has been improved since then.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: While it may bear some similarities, we won't know for certain until we've analyzed the wreckage of the Ruby Weapon.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: It cannot be denied that combining combat data from an experienced soldier with the powers of an eikon has yielded remarkable results. But in doing so, the Empire has sunk to the very depths of depravity. This is beyond forgiveness.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: For once, I agree with you. Yet one question remains unanswered: how were they able to obtain data on someone who was supposedly killed prior to the Calamity?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That's what I'm trying to determine. There is one possibility I'd like to explore, but I'll need to carry out a more thorough investigation first.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Severa will provide support while you are in the field. Not only is she extremely well versed in the latest in Garlean technology, there are few soldiers I would rather have watching my back.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: In the meantime, Valdeaulin and I will follow the Ruby Weapon's tracks back to its point of origin.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: We will learn what we can of the Weapon project and the manner in which Alfonse and the others are involved.

dialogue.name: SHADOWHUNTER
dialogue.text: Should we uncover anything of value, we will relay it to the troops stationed here. For now, I suggest you use this lull in Garlean activity to recuperate.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Would I be correct in guessing that this belated reunion with those darling orphans of yours has stirred up memories of your time in Garlemald?

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: Remember our agreement, Gaius.

dialogue.name: VALDEAULIN
dialogue.text: If you so much as think of returning to your imperial masters, I will kill you.

dialogue.name: SEVERA
dialogue.text: If the cockpit remained intact, we may be able to glean information from the pilot.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: So, you put down the Ruby Weapon? Gods, I wish I could've seen it! Not from too close, mind.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: I suppose I should report news of your victory to the higher-ups. I realize you must've been through quite the ordeal, but could you give me a quick summary of the battle?

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: You make it sound so easy! From the way you tell it, anyone would think you slay hulking brutes like that for a living! I'll put all of this into a report, and leave a copy over there, should you fancy a bit of light reading.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Anyway, I expect you've got more pressing matters to take care of, like going for a celebratory pint. If the Garleans pluck up the courage to come knocking again, we'll let you know. Until then, rest up!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, in the Werlyt magitek installation...

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: We should've told him the truth! He'd be able to help us, I know he would!

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: That's exactly the problem, Allie. If he knew the true nature of the Weapon project, he'd find some way to interfere.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: We've come too far to back down now. I won't let Milisandia's death be in vain.

dialogue.name: ALFONSE
dialogue.text: Even if that means going against Father's wishes.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Cheer up, Alfonse. We can all go back to being one big happy family after we've dealt with those pesky Eorzeans. It'll be just like old times.

dialogue.name: RICON
dialogue.text: If only it were that simple. There's no guarantee any of us'll make it back alive.

dialogue.name: REX
dialogue.text: Excuse me? I think you're forgetting whose turn it is next, O ye of little faith! With me at the helm of the Sapphire Weapon, it'll be over before you know it.

dialogue.name: ALLIE
dialogue.text: Whatever happens, Rex, promise you'll come back to us. I couldn't bear to lose you too.

dialogue.name: WEAPONSGIENGINEER
dialogue.text: Did you see that Weapon? Ah, of course you did, how silly of me! What I wouldn't give for the secrets of that armor plating!
